metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2330 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
libavcodec/gif.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.6 does not properly calculate abuffer size, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact viaa crafted .tga file, related to the gif_image_write_image, gif_encode_init,and gif_encode_close functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1').
